discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A. Project mandate: before starting up the project
B. Project management team role descriptions: starting up the project
C. Communication Management Strategy: initiating the project
D. Quality Register: initiating the project

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
In SU will be appointed the Executive and Project Manager, and this are project management team roles

PMT Team role will be defined in IP, not Su
in SU, the PMT (high level) will be nominated.

questions.question_text: Which is created during the Starting up a Project process?

discussion.content:
14.3 The project mandate should
provide the terms of reference for the project and should contain sufficient information to identify at least the
prospective executive of the project board

questions.question_text: Which should be provided by corporate or programme management before the Starting up a Project process commences?

choices.B: Sufficient information to identify the prospective Executive

questions.question_text: Which should be provided by a project mandate?

discussion.content:
14.3 
Context: The project mandate should provide the terms of reference for the project and should contain sufficient information to identify at least the prospective executive of the project board. The mandate is refined to develop the project brief.

questions.question_text: How is the tailoring approach defined for a project?

discussion.content: 4.3.2: The project manager is responsible for identifying and documenting the level of tailoring for the project. Tailoring affects how a project is managed and so it is documented as part of the PID, which is reviewed by the appropriate stakeholders and approved by the project board.
This question is misleading as there is difference between defining and approving. However the answer is chosen based on best fit as the other options are not correct.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
The project board is responsible for approving the tailoring approach. But it is the responsibility of the PM to identify and document the level of tailoring in the project

choices.B: The project board documents the approach
choices.A: The project board approves the approach

choices.C: To establish mechanisms to monitor and compare actual achievements against those planned
choices.B: To identify, assess and control any potential and approved changes to baselined products
choices.A: To prevent change to baselined products

questions.question_text: Which is a purpose of the change theme?

discussion.content: The change theme is one of the seven themes in PRINCE2 (Projects IN Controlled Environments), a widely used project management methodology. The purpose of the change theme is to identify, assess, and control any potential and approved changes to baselined products. By doing so, the change theme helps ensure that project outcomes are delivered according to plan and that any changes to the project are carefully evaluated and managed.
